acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Category 2 because of "SPECIES: Rat; ENDPOINT: LC50(4hr.; VALUE: 0.369mg/L"(ACGIH 7th, 2001)

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale:
SPECIES: Rat
ENDPOINT: LD50
VALUE: 31600 mg/kg
REFERENCE SOURCE: CICAD (27, 2000)

carcinogenicity.rationale: Since it is classified into group 3 (IARC 71, 1999) according to IARC and is classified into CBD (IRIS, 1998) according to EPA, it was set as the outside of Category.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: The substance was regarded as outside the categories. Because there are negative results from the chromosome/micronucleus analysis in human peripheral blood lymphocytes, which is an in vivo mutagenicity test using somatic cells, and the micronucleus test using mouse erythrocytes (DFGOT vol.8, 1997).

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) and the oxygen is chemically bonded only to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements).

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Since there is the description that there is obvious reproductive toxicity in the dose causing general toxicity to parent animals in rat pregnanvy inhalation exposure test (IARC 71 (1999),IRIS (1998) and CICAD 27 (2000)), it was considered as on the outside of Categry.

respiratory_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause allergy or asthma symptoms or breathing difficulties if inhaled
respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: They are classified into the airway 1st group (Japan Society for Occupational Health Recommendation, 2005) according to Japan Society for Occupational Health, and Sah (MAK/BAT, 2004) according to DFG. Since it was listed as a respiratory allergic substance by the Japanese occupationl and the allergology meeting (the Japanese occupationl and  environmental allergology meeting magazine, 2004), it was referred to as Category 1.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: It was set as Category 2A-2B from description that the eye of the rabbit is stimulated (IARC 19 (1979)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It was classified as Category 2 from description that rabbit skin was irritated (IARC 19 (1979)).

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Since it was indicated that a clear proof of skin sensitization was in CICAD 27 (2000) based on the result of Mouse Ear Swelling Test (MEST), it was referred to as Category 1.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (respiratory system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: It was classified in Category 1 (respiratory tracts) from the descriptions in IRIS (1998) and CICAD 27 (2000) that the effects on the respiratory system, such as focal/multifocal alveolar and bronchioalveolar hyperplasia, and interstitial fibrosis of lungs were seen with the concentration of the guidance value range of Category 1 in the inhalation exposure test using the rat , and from the descriptions in ACGIH (7th, 2001), DFGOT (vol.8, 1997), CICAD 27 (2000), IARC 71 (1999), and Japan Society for Occupational Health Recommendation of Occupational Exposure Limits (1993) that the respiratory dysfunction and increase in generating of a lung disease were seen in human occupation exposure cases.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 (respiratory irritant) due to the description that there is respiratory irritation to the humans in DFGOT (vol.8, 1997) and IARC 71 (1999).
